page.title: 21A69 Haltwhistle
page.content:
The A69 road (the main thouroughfare between Newcastle and Carlisle) that did run through the west end of Haltwhistle now has a bypass. Traffic on the A69 now bypasses Haltwhistle completely leaving the town to cope only with local trafic and holiday visitors. Being 'The Centre of Britian' and a short distance from Hadrian's Wall gives Haltwhistle a unique position as acentre for visitors to the area. The bypass has also opened up an area of land for industrial development which has easy access to the main trunk route.
Contribution by: Nigel Theobald
